0KR.F.summary: Kopy Goldfields AB (publ) operates as a gold exploration and production company in Russia. The company holds interests in 12 licenses covering an area of approximately 2,156 square kilometers located in the Lena Goldfields of Siberia and in the Amur Region of the Russian Far East. Its flagship project is the Krasny project that consists of three licenses with a total area of 119 square kilometers. The company is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden.

AUR.ST.summary: Auriant Mining AB (publ), a junior mining company, engages in the exploration and production of gold in Russia. The company holds interest in two producing mines, including the Tardan project in the Republic of Tyva and the Solcocon project in the Zabaikalsky region. It also holds interests in the Uzhunzhul project, an early stage exploration property located in the Republic of Khakassia; and the Kara-Beldyr project, an advanced exploration property located in the Republic of Tyva. The company was formerly known as Central Asia Gold AB and changed its name to Auriant Mining AB (publ) in June 2012. The company was founded in 2004 and is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden. Auriant Mining AB (publ) is a subsidiary of Bertil Holdings Limited.
